game

Class Disk

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Disk

  • public class Disk
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains the object Disk and its constructors and methods Disk consists of 2 main fields: color and placed. Every other field is derived from color or placed.
    Since:
    1.8
    Author:
    Garrison Henkle

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Disk()
      Constructor with no parameters Creates a disk with no color that is not placed
      Disk(java.lang.String colorIn)
      Constructor with a string parameter Creates a disk with the color, colorIn, that is placed

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getColor()
      Used to get the color of a disk
      char getColorChar()
      Gives the character representation of a disk's color 'W' represents "White", 'B' represents "Black", and ' ' represents null Useful for representing the color of the disks in the board class
      char isPlaced()
      Checks to see if a disk is placed
      void placeDisk(java.lang.String colorIn)
      Used to make a blank, unplaced disk into a a placed disk of a certain color
      void switchColor()
      Used to switch the color of a disk from black to white or vice versa

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Disk

        public Disk()
        Constructor with no parameters Creates a disk with no color that is not placed

      • Disk

        public Disk(java.lang.String colorIn)
        Constructor with a string parameter Creates a disk with the color, colorIn, that is placed
        Parameters:
        colorIn - color that is assigned to the disk when it is created

    • Method Detail

      • placeDisk

        public void placeDisk(java.lang.String colorIn)
        Used to make a blank, unplaced disk into a a placed disk of a certain color
        Parameters:
        colorIn - the color that the disk is set to

      • switchColor

        public void switchColor()
        Used to switch the color of a disk from black to white or vice versa

      • getColor

        public java.lang.String getColor()
        Used to get the color of a disk
        Returns:
        returns the color of the disk as a string

      • getColorChar

        public char getColorChar()
        Gives the character representation of a disk's color 'W' represents "White", 'B' represents "Black", and ' ' represents null Useful for representing the color of the disks in the board class
        Returns:
        returns the character representing the color of a disk
        See Also:
        Board.clear()

      • isPlaced

        public char isPlaced()
        Checks to see if a disk is placed
        Returns:
        returns the character 'Y' if the disk is placed and 'N' if the disk is not placed
